questions.question: Actions that come from the Communication leadership trait are

choices.answer: Respects the feelings and needs of others
Makes decisions carefully and objectively
Listens, speaks and writes effectively
Takes responsible risks, makes unpopular decisions

questions.question: When presented with a problem, an authoritative leader is likely to

choices.answer: Ask employees their opinion on what to do
Decide what to do and direct group members
Empower group members to reach consensus about what to do
Walk away from the group and hope they succeed
True
False

questions.question: The leadership trait Courage results in a leader who

choices.answer: Looks at all sides of an issue before making a decision
Has the ambition and motivation to get tasks done
Is willing to make decisions and take responsibility
Takes responsible risks, makes unpopular decisions

questions.question: A delegative leader is most likely to be successful when

choices.answer: Group members are knowledgeable and experienced
Group members need lots of training
Group members are young and willing to be flexible
Group members have little or no experience in the field
Not an important skill to develop
A natural ability that cannot be learned
The art of getting a group to work on a common goal
Hard to do and not worth trying

questions.question: The combined abilities of team members is greater than the ability of any single team member.

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: The leadership trait of Initiative results in managers who

choices.answer: Looks at all sides of an issue before making a decision
Follows through on commitments
Works well with others, develops group relationships
Has the ambition and motivation to get tasks done
A clear goal and an authoritative leader
A clear goal and a results-driven structure
A vague goal and an authoritative leader
A vague goal and a fluid structure

questions.question: Effective business leaders need to recognize

choices.answer: That group members are individuals who never share traits
People share values but have individual needs
That all people are the same
That employees are least effective when they work as a team
